Growler courtesy shrubber85. Banana, wheat, clove aroma. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Banana, wheat, lemon and clove flavor. Light body with a slightly dry finish. Really nice.,
On tap at Oak St. Draft House. Pours cloudy amber with a nice white head. Very nice banana, citrus, and spice aroma. Taste is the same. Nice carbonation. Really good.

Growler (courtesy of BarZigKin - huge thanks).   Banana, orange, clove and wheat malt aroma - excellent.   Cloudy golden yellow color with giant white head.  Lightly sweet banana, moderate clove and light wheat malt flavor.  Body on the light side.   A great US Hefeweizen - spot on style-wise.   If the malt flavor was more prominent, would have been in my top 5 for the style.
Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of spice, banana, and citrus. Taste is the same. Medium bodied, smooth, refreshing. Very nice hefe.

Hazy yellow with a creamy white head.  Citrus and some banana on the nose.  Medium bodied across the tongue (more banana in the nose).  Creamy texture with soft carbonation.  A really nice Hefe.  Have only seen it on draft.

This has a very interesting bubble gum flavor to it, probably a result of very strong banana and clove flavors mixing together.  Tastes very sweet to me, sometimes maybe too sweet, but its perfect on a hot summer day.

growler shared by John at STL ratebeer gathering, thanks buddy!  Pour is light yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma and flavor are light fruity spice with hints of chamomile and light squash.  Flavor also have a light tart breadiness in the finish. Solid and very drinkable.

2/23/12. On tap. First beer of RBWG 2012! Hazy orange pour with a small khaki head that fades and laces a little. Light aroma of lemon and a bit of banana and cream. Not huge on the phenolics, which I dig. Slightly sweet banana flavor with cream and light lemon followed by a bigger phenolic punch than the aroma. Light and spritzy. Nice!

In tap at the common table.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head that dissipates quickly.   The aromas are bananas, cloves, lemon zest.  The mouthfeel is bready dry and has a medium body and good carbonation.  Great beer!  Cheers!

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2015 Tasted at the 2nd STL Ratebeer Gathering, thanks jckp64. Growler from the brewpub. Poured a nice cloudy, light straw color with low, short-lived foam. Aromas of mild wheat and malt, loads of banana and black pepper yeastiness. Flavor was simultaneously smooth and tart, reminiscent of crackers, biscuits, Wheaties. Light body, low carbonation, well-rounded mouthfeel. Lingering spicy aftertaste which eventually finished dry. Very tasty.
Sampled at the StL RB gathering.  It poured a hazy amber color with a  white head. The aroma was of citrus, some coriander and ginger. The taste was of bananas, some citrus and spice. Very good.
(draught growler- sampled at STL RB Gathering) hazy light gold with white. Aroma of yeast. Flavor is clove, yeast, a little banana.

Sampled at STL RB Gathering - a very nice hefe.  Poured from a growler.  Hazy yellow with a small white head.  The aroma has grainy wheat, light banana, cloves, lots of bubblegum and a bit of spice.  Medium husky body that gets slick for the style and hen is followed with minor carbonation.  The flavor start fairly dry with husky wheat, spice, cinnamon, clove and dry bubblegum.  The finish showcases the spice aspects and is very dry for the style.  Really enjoyable beer.

Sampled at a RateBeer gathering.  A hazy 10 carat pour.  Small head.  I smell cinnamon.  The flavor is banana and subtle pepper.  A creamy feel.  This one is tasty and the pepper is a pleasant surprise.

Got this from a friend who lives in Austin, thanks man!  22 ounce Fischer swing top bottle into weizen glass, growler fill date of 2/12/2012.  Pours super hazy golden amber color with a small 1 finger dense white head with good retention that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Spotty lacing on the glass, and a fair amount of carbonation streaming up from the bottom.  Aromas of huge lemon, orange, clove, banana, bready wheat, light pepper, and yeast spices.  Nice and well balanced aromas with good strength.  Taste of big lemon, orange, banana, grainy tart wheat, clove, light pepper, and yeast spices.  Lingering notes of citrus, banana, light clove, wheat, and light spiciness on the finish for a bit.  Great balance of flavors with good complexity.  Good amount of sweetness with no cloying flavors.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very nice creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  No alcohol presence at all as expected for the style.  Very smooth to drink.  Overall this is an excellent Hefeweizen with a lot of flavor and nice complexity.  I probably got it at lower carbonation than normal due to the packaging option in the trade; but I really enjoyed this offering and would have it again.

Glad to finally get a growler. Cloudy pale pour. Nose is intense banana, cloves, various spices, vanilla, and some citrus. Flavor leaves a huge banana, and cloves presence but balanced and intense. Seems to have some rich malt like possible some bready Munich in the back end. Bright carbonation and lightly bitter in the finish. somewhat tart in the finish also. Very nice.

This Hefe pours glowing, cloudy, hazy, orange yellowish color.  A huge three finger head first appears but quickly goes down to a smaller one finger head.  This beer is just cloudy as hell.  I held it up the light but it was impossible to see through.  Now with the smell on a lot of HefeWeizens are the same. Pretty much the same thing here.   You get the aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, and lemon.  But this Hefe just pops.  The aroma is huge.  Its like a Hefe on steroids.  Best smelling Hefe Ive ever laid my nose up to.

The taste once again is simple but its big.  The yeasty wheat up front.  Banana is huge.  Nice bubblegum flavor.  It then ends with a nice spicy kick.  So easy to drink.  It will make you want more.  I finished the whole growler in one sitting.  Amazing.  Wait were not done yet.  A lot of Hefes are lacking in the mouthfeel section but not here.  This is the most full bodied Hefe Ive ever had.  Big, slick, and crisp.  Amazing.

Growler (Thanks Josh): Poured a hazy lightly dirty beige color weizen with a nice foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light bubblegum notes with some what notes and some light cloves makes this a very interesting drink. Taste is also a good mix between some bubblegum notes with some light cloves and light banana ester. Body is quite full with good carbonation. Well brewed though I usually prefer my weizen with more banana ester but glad to had a chance to try this beer.

A: Nice pale golden body. Cloudy as all hell. Large fluffy white head with decent retention. Spotty, but thick lacing left behind.

S: Upon cracking open the growler I got a huge blast of banana. Could smell it from arms length. Upon pouring wheat, light clove, and crisp lemony zest came through. Very inviting.

T: Like the nose this has four key elements going strong... banana, wheat, lemon, and clove. About half-way through the second glass I started to get a little bubble gum.

M: Simply exceptional. One of my complaints about hefes, is from time to time they dont have as much body as Id like them to have. Sure they are refreshing, but a little bit more weight can be a great thing. The live oak hefe is a perfect example of this. Nice, solidly medium bodied. Even carbonation throughout. Refreshing finish.

O: A really great beer that Ive been looking to try for a while now. So glad to get a growler to share with the lady on a nice warm spring evening. Will be seeking out again.

Growler.  Hazy straw color with frothy white head with some cling.  Nose if banana, yeast, and bready dough.  Taste follows with tons of banana and other light fruits.  Maybe a touch of lemon.  Nice clove spice.  Delicate on the mouth but with a punch of flavor.  Absolutely the best Hef I have ever had and one of the best all round beers I have ever had.  Enjoyed on a 75 degree Christmas Day in Southern California.

growler from atx consumed in one sitting 5/21/11.

cloudy orange brown hefe color with a soft white head.

aroma is wheaty, naners, orange, lemon, vanilla.

tastes like dusty wheat, vanilla, oj, lemony finish, spicy, cheerios/cereal and light saltiness.

tastes like my homebrewed hefe and an amped up version of 4P hefe.

crispy. easy drinking.

1 liter growler fill.  Courtesy of curt for bringing this back from Austin... Pours a semi-hazy golden yellow brown hue and topped with a thin to medium quickly dissipating creamy white head... Big banana and yeast aroma running rampant. Crisp and clean overall with light grain present throughout... Flavors are semi-sweet, actually moreso than expected with banana and yeastiness ever-present. Thin to medium bodied overall with low carbonation. Somewhat sweet overall.

Hazy yellow color with a medium sized, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of banana, clove, citrus, bread, toffee, and vanilla. Taste of banana, clove, vanilla, and heavy carbonation.

GABF 2011 - oh hell yes - beautiful hefe here - dry and bursting with phenols - not really strong in the banana and clove department - the phenols are more spicy, peppery and herbal, which work wonderfully with the dry, almost crackery malt profile - a touch of lemon and melon rind, but mostly dry and spicy - love it.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in H-town.  Cloudy yellow pour with a nice white head.  Grassy yeast and citrusy hop aromas.  Very refreshing and superbly balanced with lemon and other light citrus notes.  Under currents of banana, clove, yeast, and spices.  Maybe the best Hefeweizen Ive ever had.......

Growler from atxdelivery.  This is a solid beer and is right up my ally for the hot Florida summer weather.  This pours a hazy gold color with a white head dissipates to a thin layer.  Theres not much lacing, some spots slide along the glass, but dont stick.  The aroma is fairly standard for a good Hefe; banana, clove, wheat, light lemon, some herbal notes.  Nice.  There really arent many surprise flavors.  The banana, clove, and yeasty spice show but are lighter than expected with a cinnamon flavor that stands out with a touch of a palate cleansing tart citrus.  Refreshing and light-bodied.  Slightly creamy, but could stand to have a little more body.  However, I like how its so easy drinking.  I think I can drink the whole growler and then go looking for more.

Im glad to have had the chance to try this one. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Bananas, lighter spices, yeast, and bread. I found the banana and spices to be more on the subtle side - which was fine with me.

Growler courtesy of ftsgibson. Thanks! Even shipped it in a fancy styrofoam pack to keep it optimal, was still cold when I received it.

Cap opens with a nice pop.

It pours into my Erdinger glass a nice hazy gold with a great fluffy white head that sticks for awhile. Glad to see it is still nicely carbonated, it was filled and sealed well.

The smell is mostly banana with some sweet smelling wheat malt.

The flavor is lighter and more subtle than most American hefeweizens, and I like that. It has again a thick wheat character. The banana returns in the flavor along with a nice dash of clove.

The mouthfeel is the only thing I think could be improved here and it very well may just be that I am having it from a growler.

The wheat in this one give is a unique flavor but it is proabbly the best American Hefeweizen out there and better than a lot of the neutered imported German Weissbiers. However, this doesnt stack up to a fresh weissbier on tap in Bavaria, about as good as a US brewery is gonna get it without importing the exact brewing equipment, hops, malt, and yeast.

On tap at flying saucer Houston. P hazy straw yellow w soapy head. Nose is banana estters w some very faint buiscut and lemon. Taste is surprisingly smooth banana sweetness w a hint of that biscuit grain back. Bit banana sweet for my liking.

Thanks to Aaron for this! Pours really nice and hazy orange with nice lacing white head.  Aroma has notes of banana, clove, cardamom, peaches, apricot, some lemongrass, some slight honey in there as well, touch of biscuit.  Taste is nice and full bodied, taste of lemon, apricot, apple, some slight peach and nectarine, really fruity with some yeasty spice, some banana and clove notes round out the rest touch of biscuit and a nice dry and clean finish.  Wow, I could down a growler of this without knowing what happened, delicious stuff.

Bottle @ Dans house. Cloudy, milky yellow orange appearance with a fluffy white head. Slightly spicy, very yeasty, bready, lemon citrusy, mild banana aroma. Bready, very yeasty, lemon-banana bread flavor thats very smooth and very drinkable. Not as much banana and clove from the yeast and more a breadiness. Really an excellent brew but still not as good as its german counterparts.

from a growler courtesy of atxdelivery. hazy straw colored body with small white head. subtle banana, candied sugar, yeast, and a touch of clove in the aroma. flavor carries on with the banana esters and light clove, but adds a larger citrus component to it. very good and insanely drinkable.

This growler was shared at Alewatcher and Oreos birthday bash. It poured a hazy, murky vibrant gold in color with a white lacing around the glass. It looked great. The aromas, oh man! It wreaks of sweet creamed corn. I sure as hell didnt expect that to happen. Its awkward and obnoxious. I expected yeast, cloves, bananas but got none of that. The flavors too, of overly sweet creamed corn. I didnt think that was possible. Its like a crazy corn casserole in a glass. It drinks medium in body and leaves the sweet grainy flavor behind. How are people saying that this is on the level of Weihenstephaner? Dear god they arent even in the same league, let alone comparable. Im extremely thankful for getting to try this one but man was it a disappointment.

On tap at the Ginger Man in Austin. Pint of murky straw colored beer with frothy white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, lemon, and wheat. Taste is moderately sweet with a nice citrusy bite. Mouthfeel is crisply carbonated and very quenching. This is a fantastic hefe!

atxdelivery sent me a growler of this for answering a trivia question.  Totally awesome dude to do that.  Thanks a bunch.  Pale tan yellow with a light white head and lots of haze.  Nose is all sorts of cinnamin and clove, yeasty spicy goodness.  Taste is fuzzy tart with banana and light high citrus.  Lots of clove and light mid sweetness.  Very nice for a warm summer day.

Handbottle shared by bsuedekum- thanks, Blake! Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a small white ring for a head. Aroma of butter, banana, sugar, sweet malts, apricot, wheat, and some funk. Flavor of banana, lemon, sweet malts, butter, bubblegum, and sugar. Light-medium bodied, with low carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. A sweet, Americanized hefeweizen.

On tap at the Dog and Duck Pub in downtown Austin, TX.  Hazy goldenrod supporting a tall and rich white head. Explosion of banana with whisps of yeast in the aroma. Plenty more banana esters in the flavor with a healthy dose of cloves and spicy notes throughout. Smooth mouthfeel and a medium long crisp finish. Maybe the best American Heffeweizen Ive had. Too bad the lucky local Texans keep this stuff all to themselves.

Growler shared at Dstructo/Daknole tasting. Light hazy color with a thin head. Slight fruit in the aroma, banana and such. Flavor was thin and somewhat watery. Was excited to try this one but didnt really live up to the hype though.

Growler.  cloudy yellow with plenty of carbonation and freshness.  Very smooth and easy drinking. Flavor of clove and banana are balanced.  slight funk/sourness, but hardly noticeable.  Glad I got to try it, but prob wont go extremely out of my way to try again.

On tap at North Texas Beer Festival. Pours dark yellow with white creamy head. Aroma of wheat malt, aggressive clove, faint cinnamon, banana, light citrus. Flavor is very much the same. Mouth feel has a soft, light-medium body with soft carbonation. Overall, excellent brew!

A long time target short list want provided with great speed by a wonderful stand-up BA that I will just randomly send beer to from now on.

Poured from a growler into a wheat beer glass. I was nervous about the growler but when I cranked the top I heard the tell tale "HISS" of carbon escaping and a weight was lifted off my shoulders. Beer is dark yellow and completely opaque, huge haze to it. It forms an aggressive and full head of small to medium bubbles that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. Carbonation is steady and moderate. This beer looks beautiful.

The aroma is in your face with this beer. Its not quite like a wheat wine but it pushes that boundary for sure. Strong banana and cloves. Completely fills my face with this aroma. I could smell it from a couple of feet away. It is SO good.

Wonderful flavor as well. First, this is the most drinkable beer Ive ever had. Greater than 5 IMO. Medium body, slightly more body than I was expecting, but its still wonderful. Some good sweetness up front and a lot of good flavor in the back with a nice wheaty feeling to it. Great ester characters throughout the palate and beer. Gets better the more you drink. Just spectacular. The carbonation give the beer a slight sourness that helps connectivitiy. This is seriously one of the best BEERS I have ever had.

This is seriously one of my favorite beers. I should look into getting a keg of this because I would make it my daily drinker. Its a cruel set of circumstances that I am in DC and this beer is in Austin. I have an outstanding ISO Live Oak Hefeweizen out from now on.

Serving type: growler

The beer pours a deep murky gold with two fingers of white head. Good retention, leaving a soaopy head, ok lacing. 

The aroma is strong with clove dominating in a wonderful with a light honey finish, nice sweetness to balance.

The taste is super smooth starting out a little sweet with a great clove finish.

The feel is great, with a nice sweet lasting finish.

Easy drinker.

Overall, this was a great treat. By far the best hefe Ive ever had. Search out this treat.

Big thanks to xpimptastikx for this one. Poured into a weizen glass.

3.0 A: Hazed darker yellow color. Two plus fingers of frothy white head with average retention and not really any lacing.

5.0 S: Wow, really wonderful. Tons of bubblegum and clove with banana oil undertones. Appropriate level of yeastiness and a neutral wheat flavor. Pretty much perfect proportions of the major components with a lot of power behind it. Elegant, bold and robust, this is about as good as it gets.

4.0 T: The taste is also very good, but only about one tenth as powerful as the nose. Bubblegum and clove are once again my most powerful with banana second chair again. Surprisingly dry. Neutral wheat. No-off flavors and well brewed, but the taste could use a good three of four fold amplification.

3.0 M: The mouthfeel is a good deal disappointing. Medium body, but lacking the creaminess that the best hefes have to offer. Also, theres plenty of carbonation, but is fails to liven up the mouthfeel. Instead of spritzy, its a "dead" carbonation.

3.5 D: Absolutely amazing nose, pretty good taste, and otherwise sub-par. Still, Id have no problem drinking this on a regular basis. A couple glasses today did the trick and a couple more tomorrow.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 03-04-2011 01:40:26

BIG thanks to Monsone for busting out this growler at the BA Meetup @ Goose Island yesterday...

Let me just get this out of the way early:  This is EASILY the best HefeWeizen Ive ever had.

Now on to the review...

Appearance was outstanding - mysteriously murky & cloudy golden straw color (leaning a bit towards orange).  Dense layer of foamy white head that left a spotty ring of lacing around the glass.

Aroma was great - some banana and wheat - just as youd expect, but with a great deal of nuance.

Flavor was spectacular - more of the banana and smooth wheat, but also a soft, tangy twinge of sweet citrus came through that put this one into another stratosphere for me... gone was the bite you sometimes get from a hefe - this is just extremely well balanced and super smooth.

Carbonation is there (as evidenced by the nice layer of head I got on my pour), but the mouthfeel is amazingly silky.  Again - another outstanding quality of this beer.

I could drink this stuff all day and am already dreaming of the next time Ill get to try it, so hopefully I can get my hands on a growler sometime soon here...

On tap at Houston flying saucer. Golden and cloudy with a small frothy head. Aroma of citrus/banana with a little bit of spice. Taste is mostly sweet with notes of honey and banana coming through. Medium body with a creamy texture that I really enjoyed. Does well for the style and one that I would get again when in the mood for a hefe.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2012 Refrigerated hand-bottle and rebottled from growler, thanks cavie and seymour, poured into a weizen glass.  Pours hazy golden with small white head which disspates fairly quickly.  Aroma is wonderful banana and spice, very little lacing, medium carbonation.  Taste is banana, clove, some tart lemon, some spice, and some yeast.  One  of the best american hefeweizens I have had, but not quite weihenstephaner quality.

On tap at Freetail Brewpub SA(9Jan11)pours hazy orange with a tall frothy white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, creamy oatmeal, so good.  Flavor is creamy citrus and oats with pale malts and distinct sour wheat.  This is one of the best wheats I have ever had.  I love it.

Tasted on 1/8/11 from a growler brought back by a friend. Pours cloudy yellow with an average creamy white head that slowly recedes to a thin collar. The nose is classic hefeweizen with banana, clove, nutmeg, some nuttiness, and a strong yeast aroma. The flavor is somewhat acidic up front, moving to all of the banana, clove, nutmeg, hay yeast, and nuttiness. The body is medium with lively and creamy carbonation, and a long yeasty and nutty finish.
pours hazy straw color with foamy white head.  aroma is banana and clove with some citrus.  yeasty taste with plenty of citrus and yeast character.  finish is pleasant and crisp.  nice hefe

Growler courtesy of GregSVT. Thanks again, Greg!

A: Pours a dark lemon slash very pale copper with a very nice white head and a good amount of lacing as it goes down.

S: All of the requisite hefeweizen scents are there, although the bubblegum and clove take the front seat. Good balance between everything thats going on, and a bit more intense than the typical hefeweizen. 

T: The bubblegum flavor is the most intense, with a bit of clove spice coming through. Not too much banana in this one.

M: Light-medium body with good carbonation.

D: Very, very nice indeed. A good beer to sit around with all day long. I wish I had regular access.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 03-15-2010
Best hefe out there. Smells like banana, clove, funk, orange blossom honey. Tastes so good. Thick with nice head and so easily drinkable. Drink with shrimp scampi and mussels. And a dreamsicle

Growler pours a hazy, bright yellow, orange with a thin, cloudy white head.  Nose is nice and fruity, banana, yeasty esters, cloves, all spice, some Welchs white grape juice.  Flavor is sweet, light malts, white grapes, honey, bananas, a little pineapple juice.  Medium bodied, chalky finish.

[Tap] Pours a cloudy shade of yellow with a large white head. Bubblegum, yeast, banana and vanilla in the nose. Similar hefe taste, with lots of clove and vanilla especially. Subtle light fruits as well. The solid malt bill really made this beer shine. Full bodied and creamy throughout. Great mouthfeel and good carbonation for the style. Definitely a winner. Probably one of the best American made weizen beers I have tried.

Sampled at the August 10 Metro Detroit tasting.  Hazy, yellow pour with a tall, frothy white head.  Clean and yeasty with lots of lemon, moderate banana, sweet biscuit, toast, mild clove, some citrusy hops.  Very clean and drinkable hefe.  Medium-light body that finishes light and clean with moderate carbonation.

Sampled at GABF!  Glad I didnt trade for a growler of this stuff, although it is pretty solid for the style.  Murky 14 karat pour with a 1/4 inch white head.  Abundant wheat, clove, banana, and pepper both in the aroma and flavor.  More creamy mouthfeel than others.  Not bad.

Draft at Ginger Man in Plano, TX. Pours a cloudy orange amber with a white head. Banana clove ester aroma. Light bodied with an unfiltered, refreshing mouthfeel. Flavor of pale wheat malts, with banana clove phenols but with more emphasis on the clove. Yeasty finish. Not bad

Thanks BostonDoug1981!  Growler.  Pours a cloudy mix rich yellow and touches of orange with a smaller frothy white head.  Aroma is a bit bright, apple, light phenol, meat, nutty, nice depth, rich vanilla.  Fuller wheat, vanilla brings it together, faintly tart, has some richness, lightly nutty meaty which I applaud, red apple, even though it seems well attenuated it does leave a  sweet tart impression, o, thats peaches cream and sugar, not used to tasting that in a hefe.  Med/light bodied, soft fizzy spread-out carbonation, alcohol stands out a tiny bit.
1/2 gallon growler poured a murky yellow color,  hints of bannana and spices, very refreshing, lives up to the name and hype, i will have to seek out again.

A: The pour is somewhat light for a hefeweizen, tending toward a pale straw color with plenty of cloudiness and a white head.

S: A bit of the traditional banana and clove esters, but not all that intense. The wheat comes through nicely, as does a hint of citrus.

T: The yeasty esters are not as dominant as I normally like in my hefeweizens. The banana and clove are certainly there, but not they dont steal the show. Orange peel and wheat round things out, with maybe just a bit of lemon.

M: Somewhat light in body with a moderate level of carbonation.

D: I can see why this beer is so popular, especially for people down in Texas. Quite easy to drink, light, and refreshing.

12 oz. WBC bottle, poured to a home 1/2 pint glass with a slightly hazed, golden color, and bountiful, creamy, offwhite, lasting head foam that left some nice waves of lacing. The aroma was smooth, lightly bready malt, with fruit notes of banana & lemon, and some light hints of spice. The flavor followed suit, with the spice as clove being more prevalent. Hop bitterness was low but noticeable, and a lightly tart, crispness was present and propelled by lively carbonation. A very refreshing Hefe.

Ive had this on tap many times at many places here in Austin - its a standby. Classic hefe color, cloudy yellow, with a white head. Aroma and flavor both provide a nice mix of banana and clove flavors - fairly balanced with each other, actually - and peppery spices. LOs definitely got the process down to a tee for this one, and Ive not had a better hefe yet.

Hazy yellow with a decent head.  Aroma is tough to find in the smoky pub, but the taste was a bit yeasty (in a good way) with citrus in in the finish.  But pay attention after that, and theres the bubblegum.

Draft at Ginger Man in Austin. Nose is wonderful- banana citrus esters and light spicy phenols. Flavor is fruitastic-- pineapple, banana, lemon, orange-- backing wheat and malt, finishes sweet. Medium body and spritzy carbonation. A great fruit-forward hefe, balanced and easy-drinking.

Banana, peach and pepper nose with just a touch of herbal hops and cotton candy sweetness. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter with fresh herbs, lots of banana, clove and pepper and a touch of sweet peaches. Medium body is round with moderate carbonation. A very nice hefe.

Growler. Pours a straw yellow opaque color with a slight wispy head. Very cloudy. The aroma is of belgian yeast, banana, and wheat. The taste is very smooth! A fine balance of banana, clove, and wheat with a slight bitter after taste along with the yeast. Zero alcohol taste. Very refreshing. Aggressive pour yields a nice head.

I had a few hand bottles of this beer that I wasnt thrilled with so I thougt I would give it another try on draft at the Flying Saucer in San Antonio.

Pours a very cloudy dark ripe banana color that is comletely opaque with a half finger white head that quickly fades into a lasting ring. Minimal spots of lacing left behind.

Spicy peppery aroma with a huge clove presence along with hints of tart citrus fruit, mostly lemon and orange peel, as well as some bready yeast and banana. The nose on this beer is decent but is overpowered by the spicy cove presence.

Full bodied with a very prominent zesty spice character up front that lingers throughout into a sweet yet dry finish. Lots of peppery clove that provides a slightly earthy flavor balanced out by a thick bready yeast backbone with hints of sweet lemon peel and subtle banana. The fruit and yeast notes become more prominent as the beer warms but it is still a bit unbalanced for my liking. Too strong of a spicy clove flavor. Good but not the best example o the style.

Wow, suprised to see this one at the 98th percentile.  Draft pour from Irish pub on 6th street in Austin.  Sweet citrus clove smells dominate.  Tastes fresh and smooth but a little sweeter than Id like.

Growler received in a trade with BgThang who is one of the nicest traders Ive dealt with on BA.

Appearance: Lemon meringue cloudy body with an egg shell white 2+ finger foam head. Classic Belgian Wit / German Hefe look rather than the standard crappy American Wheat beer appearance. Well done!

Smell: Banana, lemon, bubblegum, and clove combine to make a signature Hefe nose. As crazy as it might sound, the smell reminds me of slightly rotten eggs / sulfer at times!

Taste: Oh baby I feel like Im at a beer garden in Germany! Clove sings when its cold and the banana takes over as it warms. Lots of delicious grain flavor as well.

Mouthfeel: Spot on.

Drinkability: Drink this one all summer long!

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 01-30-2009

Pours a color right between a banana and an orange. Its quite hazy with a big white head, just right for the style (and a relief to see coming out of a growler).  The aroma is a mouthwatering blend of bananas and clove. Its a sweet smell, chock full of yeast and wheat notes. It tends more toward the banana/bubblegum side of things than the spice, but the spice is definitely present. It smells like the batter of a spiced banana bread. There are some light lemony aromas floating around, as well. Just sublime.  The flavor is moderately sweet, a bit drier than some, though. The yeast did just the right amount of work on this beer. Its a bit lighter than other hefeweizens that Ive tried, but it works for the beer.  The mouthfeel is nice and creamy. Lots of gentle little bubbles, even from a growler. Its incredibly drinkable. One of the best session beers that Ive ever tried.

Really interesting - it has the light banana and clove of a classic hefe, but with a very distinct vanilla note that add another layer of complexity.  Just lightly tart with a very creamy mouthfeel.  Superb.
Strong spicey clove and banana aromas that carry through into the flavor.  A dirty, hazy golden brown color.  Not Bad!

Had my parents fill a growler on their trip to Austin.

A- Body is a light cloudy pale yellow hue. Pours with a large 2-3 finger foamy white head. Head eventually fades to about one finger and has great retention from there. Some lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- Nose is very good-and in line for a hefe. Soft cloves and a hint of banana come through as well as a hint of breadiness.

T- The flavor is soft and balanced all around. A presence of clove and the slightest hint of banana with a nice bready yeast backbone. The finish adds just a touch of hops and gets a little biscuty.

P- High tingly carbonation and yeasty body. The carbonation is somewhat seltzer-like. Body is nice but could be fuller and smoother.

O- This is a nice, mellow, balanced hefe. Reminds me a lot of Weihenstephaner-but doesnt do the trick as well for me. A good drinkable, sessionable beer that I would be ordering a lot if I lived in TX...but I dont think I will go out of my way to have it again here. We have local hefes that are just as nice. Still a great opportunity to try!

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 03-25-2009 20:37:54

Growler; thanks to xpimptastikx for the trade; pours hazy light yellow with eggy white head; lovely nose with cloves, bananas, bread and lemons; soft, velvety texture with lemony yeast; flavor is on the light side but plenty of body and yeasty goodness; very lively in the mouth with hay, lemons and fresh yeast; great stuff

Growler thanks to slimchill! Pours a very cloudy orangish gold with a cream color head. Aroma is full of sweet wheat notes as well as banana and clove. Flavor is similar with a sweet yet not overwhelming flavor with plenty of underlying light fruit and a bit of spice.
hazy yellow pour lots of lemon on the nose then followed by traditional banana clove flavor very  enjoyable

On tap at the flying saucer on the lake in Garland, Texas.  Cloudy straw color with a thin white head.  clove aroma with some banana.  moderate amount of mouth feel, may be slightly thin.  I did notice a small amount of hydrogen sulfide in the nose.  Not the best Hefe, but certainly better than most.

pours a hazy unfiltered yellow with a nice white sticky head. aroma is banana yeasts wheat cloves citrus esthers. flavor is  banana and clove wheat citrus spics esthers. highly unfiltered and one of the best hefes ive had. well done.

Had on tap during a trip to Austin.

Poured a cloudy golden yellow with a nice, white head. The beer smelled of bubblegum, citrus and banana. The taste was very similar with some wheat added in. I have had this beer several times and it is one of the most drinkable beers I have ever had. I have no problem drinking several of them in a row and enjoy every drop.
On tap at the Draught House. Hazy gold orange pour. Aroma is banana, citrus, clove and wheat. Flavor is vanilla, wheat, citrus and clove. Excellent lively mouthfeel.

(draught at flying saucer on the lake) pours cloudy yellow with nice head that fades to a thin film. Nose of banana, heavy citrus, spices and clove. Taste is also heavy citrus (oranges And lemons) banana, and a nice spiciness. Mouthfeel is near perfect, creamy and very well carbonated with perfect body. Maybe the worlds best hefe.

Nose is full of banana and clove. Fruity and spicy. A little wheaty. Cloudy orange yellow, thinnish head. Soft flavors initially, wheaty, with banana and clove that rides out the finish. Light bodied very drinkable. Solid.

growler. pours cloudy light amber with a dense, creamy white head. sweet banana and clove nose. creamy medium body with plenty of soft woolly carb. plenty of banana and clove on the mid palate. beautifully balanced classic german hef. lovely.
On tap at the Fort Worth Gingerman.  Smells like a package of lemon PEZ.  Tastes of clove, banana, and citrus.  Good feel.

Growler pour Thanks to ditmier for this one. Pours out a pale cloud white color topped with a  small head. Aroma was of light banana, sweetness, spice, and some yeast. Taste was more of the bananas and spices. The body was very full and thick. A top notch German Hef for sure.

On tap at the Austin Flying Saucer on October 24, 2009.  Live Oaks Hefe has a super cloudy yellow appearance, looks much like a fermented lemonade.  Tastes like one, too.  It has a silky thin white head and an aroma of yeast and lemon.  Flavor is very yeasty and lemony as well.  Its thinner than youd think.  Hints of clove and possibly corn, almost reminiscent of fresh masa.  Sour and lively.  I know this is one of the best hefeweizens you can find, but Im not incredibly impressed.  But then again, I just dont appreciate the style as much as others do.

Growler - Thanks BgThang! - Pours a pale cloudy lt tan with a small white head...aroma is unfiltered grain, spicy yeast and a bit of honey malt...falvour is nicely balanced gritty wheat, tart lemon, malt and spiced fruit...plenty of carbonation to lighten it up even after a 1000 ride on a Fedex truck...damn tasty stuff...

Draft sample at GABF 2009.  Pours a great slightly hazy straw color with a medium-sized creamy white head and solid lacing.  Aroma is banana, clove, wheat, and yeast.  Perfectly to style.  Long-lasting and full flavor of sweet pale malt and wheat, banana, clove, spice, and yeast.  Palate is medium-light and fairly crisp.  Refreshing.  This is a great, spot-on example of the hefeweizen style.

Sample at Freetail Brewing Co in San Antonio. This brew is a mostly clear yellow color with a medium thin white and creamy head that diminishes steadily. Stringy lacing. Aroma of yeast and bananas with floral touches. Light body with flavors of sweet malt, yeast and spices along with a bit of floral hops and honey. The finish is clean and sweet, leaving behind citrus and banana flavors. Pretty good Hefe all said.
On tap at the Gingerman in Fort Worth, TX. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Aroma is of banana, clove and wheat. Taste is of banana and wheat.
Growler from JW77.  Weird beer.  Yeasty and lemony with an odd perfume note.  Both in the aroma and flavor.  I am wondering if this was oxidized?  Not sure, but it wasnt too good.

I always thought Franzikaner Hefe would be the best hefe ever.  Turns out that on a side by side comparison in Austin, TX, I chose Live Oak.

The beer greets you with a slightly abundant sulphur smell.  This is not a smell that I usually would enjoy on a beer.  For this one, I cannot explain why - but it works and works really well!  The rest of the aroma brings in clove and a bit of banana.  The banana and clove follow throughout the the taste and with an ample amount of carbonation.  Delicious.  The mouth is left slightly bitter wanting another sip.  This beer makes me happy.

Growler courtesy of stopbarking.  Pours a hazy amber with a nice white head.  Smells of citrus, coriander, ginger.  Tastes of bananas, citrus, spice.  Nice, but lacking the slight tartness Im used to in a hefeweizen.
draft, great golden pulpy color with tight foam, aroma has a lot of bubble gum, flavor is good wheaty banana and spices, well balanced very drinkable, when are they going to bottle this stuff?

Pours a hazy gold like an unfiltered honey with a noce frothy white head; nice lacing.  Aroma is more bubblegum than banana here.  Flavor is hard to pin down other than the expected wheat notes; fruity without being sweet at all.  Long, cleansing astringency.  Good body.

6/1/09 notes: on tap at Draught House in Austin.  Pours beautiful yellow orange with a white head.  Aroma is full of clove primarily, followed by banana, bubble gum and apricot.  Flavor starts off with strong, flavorful banana, then kicks into spices and ripe pear.  Really a wonderful hefe.  Palate is smoother than most, some might even call it under-carbonated for the style, but all in all the feel of this beer is soft as to allow all the flavorful full attention.  One of my favorite hefeweizens Ive tried.
on tap at gingerman. poured a hazy yellow with white head and lacing. aroma of lemon, clove. flavor was the same with the addition of banana. body was medium with low to medium carbonation.

Growler, courtesy keifdog. Foggy golden pour, massive fluffy white head, wet lacing. Sweet malts in the nose, dry wheat, clove, spices and cinnamon. Big fruit flavors, dry wheat, hazy grain, some spices. Medium-bodied, very refreshing and drinkable as hell. Not bad at all. I wouldnt kill a school bus full of children to drink it, but its good.

Thanks kiefdog for the share.  Pours hazy yellow with a nice white head.  Nose is typical hefe- light fruit, banana, and clove.  Flavor is similar- light fruit, banana, clove, spice, and goodness.  Noticeable yeast and lots of sweetness.  Very enjoyable, medium-bodied hefeweizen.
Growler courtesy of kiefdog. Hazy yellow pour thin head. Nice yeasty aroma, spicy, cloves, slight banana nose. Tastes like it smells. Overall refreshing nice hef.

Growler courtesy of screach. Pours a slightly hazy dark yellow with one finger bright white creamy head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of grain, yeast, banana, light citrus, clove. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of banana, clove, yeast, sweet fresh flowers, some hints of spice, honey and caramel. Generally light to medium body with a pleasing wheat finish.

growler courtesy of kiefdog
pours golden, thin white head
Aroma sweet, fruity, grassy hops and grains
Taste, lots of sweetness, some banana, sweet honey, light grainy/wheat finish

Growler from lb4lb. Thanks Deniz!  Shared with emacgee and durhambeer.  This is excellent beer.  Poured this into some nice ayinger weizen glasses I had.  We enjoyed these on a beautiful sunday afternoon while playing some cornhole. This beer smells like spring--fresh, slightly fruity, yet dry and refined. Tastes great too. Enjoyable hefe that I could see myself drinking more than one of in one sitting.  Best hefeweizen Ive had.

Decided to rate this for my 1500th. Thanks turdferguson for sharing this growler. Pours a soft hazy gold with a two finger creamy white head. Very very nicely carbonated, especially considering the growler aspect. Nose is very nice, wheaty, yeasty, soft banana, very mild clove character. Flavor is nice and wheaty, mild tartness, banana and clove to a small degree, yeast comes through nicely. Crisp feel with a nice sharpness. Palate is very full and smooth. Soooo good.

Growler shared by Turd.  Thanks, Sam!  Cloudy deep golden pour and white head that sticks around.  Orange, lemon, and banana notes on the nose as well as wheaty yeast and floral notes.  Hint of bubblegum.  Surprisingly nice citric notes combined with a great dry palate.  This is a damn fine beer.  Could dry it all summer long... if it was available around here.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2009 12oz handbottle courtesy of a very generous BA, opened 4-5-09

Pours a very hazy golden yellow with a short-lived one inch white head that recedes to nothing fairly quickly and leaves no lacing.

The aroma is much citrusy than I expected with a big dose of tart lemon aromas and even a hint of funk.  The typical wheat presence of bananas and bubble gum sweetness are definitely present but take a bit of a back seat.  Very unique nose for the style.

The taste is even more tart than the aroma with a huge lemon zing up front that hardly allows the sweetness of the wheat to come through at all.  The finish is dry and acidic with more than a hint of funk lingering in the aftertaste.

The mouthfeel is a little slick with low carbonation, likely due to this being from a handbottle.

This is one of the more unique hefes Ive had and while I do like it, I really think there is a bit too much tartness and funk for this to be a world-class version of the style.  Maybe it was the handbottling, but I was a little underwhelmed.

EDIT 5-8-09: Poured from a growler and it became very clear that the bottle was, in fact, off. There was none of the off-putting tartness from the hand bottle and the aroma and taste were almost perfect representations of the style - a great balance between light lemony citrus, fresh bananas and spices. A great beer.
On tap @ The Dog & Duck Pub in Austin: Pours a cloudy straw yellow with an off-white head leaving nice lacing. Has a citrusy, lemon aroma and flavor. Very smooth and refreshing with a dry finish.

Growler shared by cdumler. Thanks! Pours a very hazy orange peach color with minute particles floating in the beer. Large head shows great retention and light mottled lacing. Aroma of strong yeast and bread with spice and light fruit notes. Taste is yeast, dough, earthy spices, cotton candy and light fruits. Medium bodied.

Name: Hefe-Weisse
Date: February 17, 2009
Mode: Draft
Source: Gingerman, Houston
Appearance: opaque light orange, creamy off white head, thick spidery lace
Aroma: light sweet banana aroma with just a hint of clove
Body: creamy body
Flavor: sweet banana flavor, light balancing clove
Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *4

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2011 Found on tap @ Freetails. Cloudy light orange pour. Standard hefe smell. Taste is rich in wheat grains. Tasty, clean finish. 4.0
RE-RATE 2/26/11 Tap at Gman FW. It pours a very cloudy/hazy light gold color with a foamy white head. The slice of lemon accentuates this appearance.

The aroma is of dry grain, sweet fruit which is a mix of banana, citrus and lemon. There is a fair bit of yeast in this as well.

The flavor is also bready sweet with a big taste of banana and other fruit. There is a slight sense of spicyness like coriander but only in the slightest.

Adding the lemon provides a lovely citrus tart that is also balanced with the flavor of candy cigarettes. You know those kind you used to get from the ice cream man as a kid that blew smoke? And when you heard the ice cream truck coming you would tear through the house like a madman looking for a freaken dollar? I swear, wanna teach a kid a sense of urgency? Send the ice cream man by. But then you ended up puffing the candy cigarette, and you know they only have 1 good puff in them, so if your friends werent watching when you did it you flipped out? That gum wasnt even that great either, but that never seemed to deter me. Yeah.this beer tastes like that. Holy crap what a tangent!

On tap. Pours with a hazy gold body under a large, foamy white head that leaves good lace. Aroma of orange, clove and vanilla...Nothing special for a hefe. Taste wise though, this is a good beer! Vanilla overtones over a creamy banana foster and light clove body. Great drinking stuff. Lively bubbles, and water like mouthfeel.

Courtesy GodofThunder.  Murky dark straw color, thin white soapy head.  A lot of clove on the aroma, some overripe banana, something a tad off about the phenolic notes.  Nice effervescent mouthfeel.  Light on the taste, with the phenols calmer with a mild sweetness on the back end.

Growler from GodofThunder. Pale, hazy, light gold. Small but thick head. Oily smell is off-putting, described by Dragonstout as ground beef which explains it, being I dont like ground beef. Strange aroma, especially in a beer. Mouthfeel is sweet and slightly sticky. Flavors are not as skank as the aroma but the sour meat is still there. I really did not get it or if I got it I did not like it.

Growler, courtesy GodOfThunder.  The pour yields a very cloudy, glowing, tangerine orange body.  A small, foamy, off-white head settles to a wispy film with a bubbly edge.  Minimal, spotty lacing marks the glass.  The nose features overly ripe bananas prominently, with a substantial creaminess imparting a milkshake like aroma.  Further scents include candied lemon and orange rinds, browned apples, and spicy clove and nutmeg.  Flavors show more of the same, a faint wheat malt base fading into sweet, mushy bananas and cream, with more candied citrus, nutmeg and clove.  Floral hops lend balancing bitterness, but this one is all about the fruit and spice content.  Relatively light in body, with lively carbonation, a more substantial palate might solidify this as the best Hefewizen Ive ever had.  While it doesnt quite achieve that status for me, it is certainly an outstanding example of the genre.

Thanks to SlimChill for the trade.  Pours a cloudy, and spiced, golden color.  Smell is strong, with bananas, clove and cream.  Flavor is thick and bready with more banana and clove.  Overall, a very good Hefeweizen.  Very drinkable and not lacking any flavor.

Growler... Cloudy, straw-colored ale with a small, creamy, white head. Beefy, fruity aroma with banana and bubble gum esters blended with clove and light smoke phenols. Medium to full-bodied and very creamy with tingly carbonation. Nice, fruity flavor offers banana, clove and gentle smoke. Fairly sweet, but not annoyingly so. Fruity, spicy finish. Its a style of beer I really dont like, but this one is pretty darn good. Big-time thanks to GodOfThunder for sharing!

Big thanx to God of Thunder for sharing this growler.Ok call me strange but the 1st smell that hits me is raw groundbeef and thankfully it didnt translate to the flavor.The rest of the nose was bready, bananas and cloves.Flavor was clean and refreshing chock full of spices, bananas and citrus.

Growler. Sweet wheat aroma. Crushed grains. Bread dough. A bit of clovey spice, but fairly dry and cereal like yeast presence. Pours a thick, hazed, dark gold with a massive bright white head. Lots of wheat on the palate. A hint of banana bread. Mild tartness. Very refreshing. Definitely bready and dry. Full bodied for a hefe. Creamy, lush texture leads to a perfumy and aromatic finish. Thanks fellas!

Draft at Ginger Man Austin. Poured a hazy yellow orange color with a white head. Smelled of clove, banana, and cereal grain. there was also a whiff of orange. Light to medium bodied. Hay, cereal grain, clove, and orange flavors predominated with only a bit of banana. Solid hefe.

Draft @ the Gingerman. Pours a hazy gold, fluffy white head, nice lacing down the glass. Aroma of tart wheat, citrus, bready yeast, light cloves and lemon soaked lady fingers. Creamy tart wheat, lightly sweet with hints of lemon, bready yeasts, again very restrained clove. Lush and drying in the mouth, light and slight tartness. Really solid hefe.

Growler  Cheers to my weekend highlight. Very tasty hefe, a style itself which is most pleasing. I haven’t a vertical tasting with the Town Hall version, fond memories of blowing me away, rather this stands on its own. Tasty,though a tad dry. Very creamy mouthfeel. The head looked great.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 Tap.  Poured a hazy straw-yellow color with a moderate fluffy white head that stuck around for a while.  Aroma is mostly clove and banana with some light citrus, a light spiciness, and some dough.  Flavor consists of a moderate wheatiness with some doughy malts, a strong clove spiciness, some banana and light citrus that finishes with a moderate yeastiness.  Rather creamy on the palate.  Definitely a good hefeweizen.

On tap at Flying Saucer - Houston on 07/27/08. Cloudy orange yellow body with a small creamy white head. Big clove and banana aroma. More big clove flavor with light banana. Medium body with fairly high carbonation.
On tap at the Old Monk in Dallas.  Color is a cloudy yellow to golden.  Decent white head.  Smell is citrus, clove, spices, and floral.  Taste is wheat, and fruits.  Good body and feel.

on tap at Draught House in Austin.  Pours a pale, cloudy yellow with a white head.  Nose is of spices, yeast and banana.  Taste is of banana, wheat, yeast and slight lemon.    Mouthfeel is medium and is smooth and creamy.  Liked it better as it warmed.  I’m not a hefe fan, but this wasn’t bad.
Whenever I head to Alamo, this is my first choice. A near great hefe. Cloudy and spicy in the nose. Not too watery in the mouth feel, with a lingering tartness. Keep it up Live Oak. Nice beer.

Courtesy of tpd975. Pours straw filled orange juice with thin white head. The aroma is fresh bold wheat along with lesser notes of honey, lemon, apple and honeydew melon. The taste isnt as bold but good with wheat, honey like sweetness, a hint of bubble gum and some acidity tartness. The later half of the taste has notes of lemon, some spices of some sort and more sweetness.

On tap at Lovejoys w/lemon wedge in pint glass.

Not much of "a thick, creamy head," but a lightly spiced, floral/citrus aroma and columns of tight little bubbles rising through translucent pale yellow-orange.  Absolutely brilliant balance of refreshing, complex, and subtle.  Comparable to the best German hefes.  Probably doesnt hurt that its local.

hand bottle.  Pours a cloudly orange with a medium white head.  Banana and clove aroma.  Flavor is BAM clove,  banana,  orange peal,  lemon,  and wheat.  Finishes kind of thin,  very light and refreshing.  I need more,  very good!

Hazy light yellow color with a white head and little retention.  Smell of banana, cooked vegetable, bread, and lemon.  Taste has some banana, bread, and clove.  Higher end of carbonation, thick, but still medium bodied.  Pretty drinkable, and a good beer to drink for the summer.  Thanks to pepsican for the sample.

This poured cloudy and deep yellow to light golden in color with a moderate white head.  The nose was filled with classic aromas of banana and clove, spice and some yeast.  In the mouth it was medium-bodied with good weight but also very drinkable.  This was really well-balanced and quite drinkable...great start to the long 4th of July weekend!

bottle from keg @Joes NYC Gathering shared by rciesla/Ryanpours a big foamy white head with cloudy straw color.  Aroma is clove/pepper, banana, wheat.  Taste is clove/pepper, banana, wheat, some tart fruit.  Much milder/thinner than the aroma although no detractors.

Sample @ Flying Saucer Draught Emporium (Houston). Good banana aroma. Hazy yellow body with white head. Vanilla and banana flvors were very good. Left a bubble gum aftertaste on palate. Real good hefe was told by local had to try this one glad I did.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2011 Bottle at JoeMcphees, Kevins party, and a split with BrianK just to finish this one off.  Pours a hazy yellow orange body, lovely.  A/F is sweet fruity, orange, lemon, spicy pepper, clove and cinnamon.  So drinkable think i put a head bomber down in 5minutes wow, i see why all the BAs go crazy.

first impression is the aroma, it is nearly all canned pineapple in juice, this is not a slam.  suspended yeast and a nice small almost pinpoint carbonation.  phenols from the yeast specifically clove and banana.
Tasting at JoeMcphees. Unfiltered yellow. Meaty yeast nose.  Clean mouthfeel, spicy carbonation. Yeast throughout. Good Hefe.

22oz bottled from keg: Cloudy yellow beer. The aroma is musty basement and German yeast ester of banana. Thin bodied with a simple flavor. Papery malt and very mild lemon peel and a late mineral touch. Simple.

22 oz from a keg. Smells like a dopplebock. Light yellow with sulphur in the nose. Plenty of vanilla with some clove but very light, peppery (also very subtle). Merangue flavor like lemon are also there. Solid brew.

A softish pour produces an almost one finger thick, pale, tan tinged head that sits on top of a deeply hazy, straw colored beer.  When held up directly to the light it picks up some orange tints, but is still completely opaque.  The aroma is quite hearty, lots of yeast notes from, surprise - surprise, actual yeast as well as ample clove notes, a hint of banana and lots of wheat / grain aromas.  This last supplies some wheat-tartness, aromas of crushed saltine crackers and a rich, chewy, crushed grain aroma.  The tartness accentuates a touch of fruitiness reminiscent of something like a cross between a pear and tropical fruit.  This is just very hearty smelling for a HefeWeizen & quite enjoyable, the depth of the grain character is quite nice.

Not as thick as I was expecting based on the rich aromas, instead it has a nice light texture & heft to it like a good HefeWeizen should.  I was half expecting / dreading that this was going to be overly under-attenuated, I am quite happy it is not.  Perceived sweet notes linger on the palate with a mix of clove and banana notes.  Soft and creamy, yet with a prickly carbonation, this beer has a certain viscousness to it that coats the palate, but does not keep this from being light and quaffable.  Lightly tart, which accentuates a very soft fruitiness, but mostly plays up the chewy wheat flavors.  This has lots of grain character to it; chewy, slightly dried-grass like, a bit of hay, a full wheat grain flavor and a crushed cracker note.  The finish has a mix of clove flavors, light hop bitterness and a slight, herbal hop flavor.

As the beer warms a bit the banana flavors become a bit more accented & this accentuates an up front, grain sweetness.  This is eminently quaffable; there is just enough sweetness to accentuate some soft fruit, clove and grain character.  Really it is the fresh grain character that makes this beer so tasty; I cant remember having a HefeWeizen that tasted fresher and the vibrant grain character is what is driving this vibrancy.  This only gets tastier and more well balanced as it warms up.  I am towards the end of my 22oz serving and am finding myself wishing for more; the banana is definitely much more noticeable than the clove that was more noticed at the cooler temps, but it is still not overly much.  This is a damn tasty HefeWeizen, a style that I have forgotten how good it can actually be if done correctly; this is certainly one of the finest examples that I have had, my guess is that they use a Decoction mash; there is almost no better way to get such a vibrant grain character into a beer.  Fantastic!

Birthday! .... Quite tangy 4 a hefeweizen ... very refreshing ... is a peach juice colour .. lacing is over average ... hate to say it but might benefit from a lemon wedge?!?! ... decent but fresh ... i will have this again because I know this is better than my score..

Many thanks to Ken for bringing the growler!  Poured cloudy paler gold with a moderate cap of white head.  The aroma picked up delightfully prominent banana upfront with a complement of bubblegum.. never struck me as artificial, and I thought it presented itself very well.  Sweet in the flavor department, again at the hands of banana and bubblegum.. picked up a small dose of vanilla and tart lemon zest at the edges.. tasty!  Sweet and grainy on the palate with enough carbonation to move it smoothly across the palate.  Excellent beer!

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2008 22oz handbottle, courtesy of thickerfreakness from BA.  Thanks, Charles!  Pours a murky, whitish-golden color; bright white head with solid, fine-bubbled lacing.  Solid amounts of bananas, cloves, and a touch of zesty citrus and minerals in the aroma.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: chewy bananas, esters, and Belgian sugar; could use some of the zesty hops that originally showed through in the aroma; chewy hefeweizen, with plenty of fruit and esters.  Medium finish: bananas, toasty malts, and a touch of cloves.
Very good Hefe!!!  Loaded with bananas, cloves, and a sweet citrusy aroma and flavor...
murky gold pour with a white head.  malts and wheat on the nose.  very good smell for a hefe honestly.  nice wheat and citrus flavor that is very refreshing.

Aroma is wheaty, banana, yeasty. 
Taste is sweet banana gum, wheat
Some mild bitterness and nice legs.
Very solid.

On tap at the Flying Saucer, San Antonio.  Pours with a golden/straw color, aroma of wheat and bananas leap from the glass.  This thing has a rich wheat base, which I like with just the right amount of banana and a hint of bubblegum.  Lots of cloves as well and even a mild hop kick.  Rich and thick, yet still clean and refreshing.  Probably the best hefe Ive had.
Pours a beautiful hazy gold into the glass with a nice white head.  Aroma is wonderfully yeasty.  Flavor is superb, by far the best Live Oak Ive had

Out of a growler sent by lb4lb as a great bonus treat.  Hazy yellow gold color with a big, fluffy white head that left some lacing on the glass.  Sharp clove and banana nose.  Very traditional German Hefeweizen.  Flavorful with lots of banana, clove spice, home made bread and some lemon.  Realy nice beer.  Much thanks to Deniz for a chance to try this example of one of my favorite styles.

22oz hand bottle from lb4lb. thanks! lots of carbonation left in this one. nice! pours hazy light faded golden with white head. banana and clove, lemon, and wheat aroma. flavors are wheaty, cloves, banana, lightly spicy finish. clean and very easy drinking. a nice hefe for sure.
This is quite simply the best American beer I have ever had. Pure liquid joy. I had it on-tap at the Flying Saucer in Houston. Now I need to figure out how to get a growler....

Shared at Cleveland tasting 3/15 Growler: Pours a hazy gold with a white head. Aroma, lemon, wheat, doughy notes, some light fruits. Flavor, lemony, wheat, yeasty notes, doughy malts, some banana. Nice and light, good stuff.
Bottle shared at the Cleveland tasting. Pour was hazy yellow. Aroma and taste was citrus and banannas. Nice hefe.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2016 On tap at Flying Saucer. Has a cloudy golden color with a large white head. The aroma is banana dough and wheat. Decent lacing on the glass. The taste is like the aroma with lemon zest. Crushable, my go to hefeweizen.

Thanks JDV for the opportunity to try this one also my first growler ever. Might as well start of with one of the best 

Growler poured into my Ayinger Weizen Glass produced a good two fingers worth of head that settled down to a nice layer of lace on top of a cloudy apricot colored body It is a gorgeous looking Hefeweizen I wouldnt believe that a growler would keep this much carbonation 

Aromas on this one is striking as well, you get wonderful banana bread in a glass type smell (bananas, cloves, Bread dough) Bubblegum as well 

Yes wheat banana bread in a glass flavors as well a nice citrus bite 

Mouthfeel is exceptional a little heaver than I expected for a wheat beer, nice crisp carbonation on your tongue.

Great drinking Hefeweizen Ill repeat the statements made before me I cant believe it was this good coming from a growler. Thanks again to JDV on shipping it right. If you have the fortunes to get a growler I say go for it. My new favorite Hefeweizen
Draught: Over ripened bananas well past the prime. Sour aroma with some spice. Light cloudy yellow with a fluffy head. Flavor strong yeast, banana, some grain. Very fruity. Nice full body, MMM.
Draught. Strong banana and yeast aroma with some spice. Cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Flavor is bubblegum, bananas, clove-like spice and yeasty acidity. Full-bodied palate. Really great hefe.

I usually dont gravitate towards Hefeweizens, but d-d-d-Damn! This one definitely caught my attention. Crisp, fruity sweetness well-balanced with substantial wheat flavors. On tap at Flying Saucer. !!!

(Tap @ Flying Saucer, DT HOU TX): Pours a very cloudy yellow color. Creamy white, small & somewhat lasting. Clove spicy banana aroma. Ripe bananas. Very enticing. Ripe banana taste. Clove, not too watery. Very fruity. Reminds me of a jelly-filled donut.

Pours extremely cloudy gold with a big white rocky white head that dies quick. Smells of big clove, orange peel and banana bread. Taste is ripe banana, a little clove, minor metallic character and minor spice. Refreshing in the mouth and very drinkable. A great hefe for sure.

Thanks to geuzelover for the growler. Served in my 20oz New Glarus Weizen Glass. Gotta love the right glassware for a beer. I read the BJCP style guidelines for this beer right before the review so Id be on the correct page.

A: Dark straw body. It is very opaque. There was a bit of a white head initially, around a quarter inch, but it fell quickly. Ill blame that on it being a growler. Carbonation is visible.

S: Clove and banana are very dominant in the aroma with some lemon and wheat rounding out the bouquet. The clove is really strong and it almost has a slight smoky character but I think thats just my mind trying to interpret the cloves.

T: The wheat was more subdued in the aroma, but its right up front in the flavor. Likewise, the powerful clove presence isnt nearly as strong in the flavor but provides a little spice to the beer and comes on a bit stronger in the aftertaste. The banana is there as well but less in the flavor than in the aftertaste which has a strong banana character. All the flavors blend nicely to create a very smooth beer.

M: The amount of carbonation is pretty surprising for a growler. It works great for the style which should be pretty highly carbonated. Tastes pretty full bodied in the beginning and middle of the taste, but as it leads to the aftertaste the body seems lighter and finishes perfectly.

D: Damn fine hefe all around. Especially considering it was from a growler.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2008 THe perfect medium-bright, golden cloudy color. Great sweet aroma and taste. Hints of lemon, banana, clove, spice, and white oak. This is one of the best hefes Ive ever had. It has a sweet, dry citrus taste and is loaded with flavor.  Its moderately carbonated, and has little head. Its pretty smooth, but that dry fizzyness develops on the backend. Finish is smooth, light malty wheat with that little bit of sourness you get with all Live Oak beers, probably due to their horizontal mash tanks. Theres even a little bit of clumpy wheat particulate that made it through the tap when one gets to the bottom of the glass.

On tap at the Addison Saucer July 2005. My wife actually ordered this to celebrate the Saucers Texas $2.50 pints sunday special.  
LOH pours a cloudy pale color with a tight, white head with brown specks in it. Very pungent smell of spices, cloves, and citrus fruits.Big bodied with bubbly carbonation. The strong taste follows the smell with sweet tart wheat malts and a nice mesh of spices and citrus flavors. The finish is crisp and clean. 

A very easy drinking, and very tasty beer here. Hefes dont get much better than this.
