text: STOUTWIZARD IS JUST JEALOUS BC HE DOESNT TASTE LIKE ROTTEN FRUIT OR SCROTUM! this is my fav beer of all time! must try when in texas!
Terrible.  Its like a mix of scrotum and rotten fruit.  I had to gargle kerosene to remove the taste.  The mouthfeel, however, was world-class.
This was a very middle-of-the-road Hefe and not nearly as good as I was hoping.  It almost appeard to be filtered and that certainly isnt good for a Hefe.
Tap.  Probably the best beer I got in my short trip to texas.  A very good hefe with a light citrus and aster taste.  Not bad at all.
Draft. Yellow beer with thin head. Clove, flowers and bubble gum on the nose. Clove, flowers and bubble gum on the taste. Eh.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2008 Draft. Initial taste and smell werent very delightful.  Once lemon was added, it became drinkable - but that is not how I prefer to drink my beers.  Not the worst beer Ive tasted, but nothing to write home about.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2009 On tap. Pours a nice yellow/ light golden color with a small oily head. Nose is clove an banana but it is a very understated aroma. Taste is extremely well balanced and has nice light wheaty taste, that is rounded out by a lemon and sour finish. When lemon was added it brought out the taste even more which is rare for me to do but as an experiment I tried it and the flavor really blossoms.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Yellowish cloudy gold color and smells very strongly of wheat, with some banana and clove, even more so than most hefeweizens.  Taste is big and flavorful, bubble gummy, smooth and refreshing yet hearty and wheaty.  For the style I can tell this is well done, very flavorful and a good beer all around.  If you like the style, I think youll love this one.

Sampled on tap at the Fort Worth Ginger Man.  Slightly cloudy, pale yellow pour, small white head.  Huge banana nose!  A small of clove underneath.  Crisp, light, refreshing body  active carbonation.  Flavor is dominated by the banana notes, spiciness comes out as it warms.

At Flying Saucer San Antonio.  Tried this one while visiting from California.  I had been looking forward to this one for a while.  I was so hoping that I would like this one as much as the ratings suggest.  Well, as soon as the bartender brought the pint over, I was a little worried.  Absolutely no head whatsover, but thats the way beer gets served to you most of the time.  Ok, no big deal.  But then the appearance.  A slight orange tint, but not much haziness and easy to look through the glass, too easy!  Ok, lets take a whiff.  Ah, much better.  The banana,  clove, bubblegum aroma was there, and fairly strong.  Very promising.  Lets taste this thing already.  Mmm, very nice.  A good sour kick, with the flavors that make a good hefe.  Well, so where does this leave me?  I was very happy with the aroma and taste of this beer.  Although the appearance was lacking for me compared to other great hefes, I feel this one came through in the end.  Im glad I finally had the opportunity to try it.
On tap. Hazy, orangish color. Banana and some citrus on the nose. Very crisp taste. Lots of citrus. Nice.

On tap at the Flying Saucer Addison. Hazy, yeasty, bright yellow color. Nose is evident from across the table. Very fresh beer. Banana, wheaty, some spiciness. A very refreshing beer and one of, if not the best Hefeweizen on the market.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Tap at Alamo Drafthouse. Cloudy golden.  Aroma of cloves, yeast.  Wheaty flavor with pine hops with citrus.

On tap at the Flying Saucer.  Poured a hazy golden color typical to most Hefeweizens.  Smelled of bananas and cloves.  The flavor was a bit lacking.  I found it to be quite bland and felt that it absolutly NEEDED the slice of lemon it came with (when I normally prefer a hefe w/o the lemon).  As someone stated before, it felt pretty thin in the mouth.  It was decent, but if I am going to have a hefeweizen I will look elsewhere.
cloudy amber.  Fairly spicy, with a subdued banana note which is a pleasant change.  Always better fresh, and when you should be at work.   Bit thin in the mouth.

On a trip to Houston, I sampled a 5 oz draft serving of this beer as part of the Texas sampler at The Flying Saucer bar downtown.  It was a solid hefeweizen, but in my opinion not deserving of the extremely high ratings it has received.  The aroma was a bit wheaty and had some yeast notes, and featured grassy hops.  Color was a cloudy-white golden with a good-sized white head.  Smooth texture, without a lot of carbonation.  The flavor was good and wheaty, a touch of sweetness, but mostly bitter and sour.  A good beer, just not spectacular.
A great hefe. Superb on tap, only wish in came in the bottle. Very crisp for a hefe, but all the same good hints of honey and buckwheat.

Pours cloudy and golden.  The aroma comes out to welcome you with esters all over along with faint yeast and bubble gum, a little cream butter as well.

The taste is thick, rich, bready with a buttery sweetness.  The flavors are mild with banana, white pepper and cloves present in the background, not overpowering.  Subtlety is the watchword and fresh is best.  Texture is smooth and velvety with a moderately heavy mouthfeel.

Balance is what earns this brew a near-perfect score.  Ive had fresh hefeweizens with strong fruit and clove elements but this beer is so delicately made so as flavors come together in a symphony instead of individual components.  Even as it warms, the flavors remained nuanced and complementary, never turning or tiring towards the inevitable warmer end.  Nothing dominates, thus everything works.  The palate never tires and I could drink this all day.

Ill agree that the rating is pretty high, but when leveraged against other Texas breweries (sadly), this hefe-weizen really is a standout. Cloudy, medium bodied, refreshing. Good initial wheat flavor. Average finish--a little too dry perhaps.

Im going to have to disagree with the high ratings of this beer.  I drank many hefes while in San Antonio, and while this is decent, it isnt great.  Very smooth to drink, nice color, decent flavor, but it was lacking in body for me.  Too thin, not enough flavor.
Draught at Crickets Grill, WacoHazy deep yellow color. Very simple Hefeweizen, dry, with some spicy character.
Tap in 2004.  Cloudy yellow color.  Orange, citrus, and corriander aroma.  RIch with a long aftertaste spiced with orange.  Rating from notes.

cloudy straw color tall white thick laced head.  Sweet sugar on grain aroma sweet banannas.  Avg pal.  Flavor is grainy some banannas and candied sugars... pretty 1 dimensional in its sweetness, I felt there were many better hefes out there.
GABF 2006.  The beer pours to a hazy straw colored body with a thick white head.  The aroma is tart wheat, cloves, banana flavor is typical.  Light tart palate.
Foggy gold with a thin white head, with a very lively aroma, which includes tons of banana, citrus esters with nutmeg. Flavor taste is banana, cloves, pineapple, and wheat.

Little shocked at the high ratings this beer generates. Had many times on tap in Austin. A good beer for the area (sorry, Texas beers dont but it). Nice wheat taste. Light. A great wheat? No. But worth it if it is on tap, and in Austin, few good beers are on tap.

On tap at a bar in Austin, pours a hazy light orange, with a nice white head and good lacing down the sides.  Smells like a heffe--bananas and a yeasty aroma.  Tastes mostly of yeast, with some bananas and citrus at the end.  Id say its a middle-of-the-road heffe.

Pour is opaque warm orangey yellow with a thin dense white head...smell is cloves, banana, yeast, bubble gum, light citrus...taste is taste is rich and wheaty...banana, light spices...full bodied and fruity...finish is dry and yeasty with some likght citrus hints...this should be a top 50 beer...

Super cloudy gold, thick creamy lasting white head.  Soft nose of cloves, trident bubblegum, and banana, with lesser tones of grass and yeast.  Similar in flavor with the clove, banana and bubblegum dominating throughout.  Light bodied, spritzy carbonation, fruity spiced finish.  I liked it quite a bit,  but at times this one seemed like it was trying too hard.  Either way, worth downing a few if you have the chance...
Cloudy as can be. Huge banana and clove esters with a nice bubblegum finish. One of the fruitiest hefes Ive ever tasted.

On tap. Insanely cloudy, like watered-down orange juice. Sweet grassy smell, with orange and clove hints. Very full-bodied for a wheat. Balanced flavors of citrus, malt and yeast, and some grassy notes. Firm, dry finish - very even. And I generally dont care much for hefes.

Really not a hefe fan, but had to try this based on the ravings of a few friends at the bar. Like the rest of the Live Oak line, well crafted and tasty. This is one of the few Hefes that I might seek out.

My favorite heffy by far. Im not a big fan of spiced beers and regretably theres a whole lot of wheat beers out there that cater to the "dump in the spice cabinet" crowd. This wheat just knocks my socks off. HUGE rocky head over a golden swamp of yeast beasties. Dry grapefruit rind finish that refreshes.

Hopefully as Live Oak expands distribution theyll continue to spend as much time lovingly crafting this divine product. If it werent for the limited distribution around the Texas hill country I fully expect this would be touted as one of the best hefes in the country, if not the world. Ive even had a pint off of a keg that had been shaken up, so it looked like I was about to drink a straight yeast culture, and even then this beer still walked all over the competition.

It pours a beautiful golden straw hue, nice head. The perfect balance of citrus aromas greets the nose and the palate on first swallow, followed by a bit of spice with a hint of wheat. This is easily the most drinkable hefe Ive ever had the pleasure to consume, even if there are bolder, more experimental hefes out there to compete in the knock-your-socks-off arena. This one is definitely a summer mainstay here in Austin. 
As others have stated, I hate to give this one a perfect five but its only fair since I cant for the life of me figure out how this beer could be improved.

Strong, sweet banana blends well with the wheat apparent in the aroma with mild spiciness.  Opaque milky yellow body with a strong and lasting, fine bubbled, dense, white head that laces.  Strong, full-on banana flavour up front with fresh wheat and light clove spiciness.  Creamy smooth texture to the medium light body with carbonation that is perhaps just a bit low for the style.  Sampled at GABF 2005.

Vast creamy and rocky white head lasts forever over the murky, almost muddy golden veil. A tremendous yeast showdown, offering the doughiest flavours that belong on nothing but a pie, yet phenolic enough to be soapy and bandagey, cloves in abundance. On the other side of the spectrum, the malt sweetness is also important, vaguely reminding of honey, cotton candy. Huge bubble gum component, fluffy medium body. Oily texture, enough tartness to keep everyone happy. A splashy hefeweizen that showcases sheer yeast power.

Sampled @ GABF- Pours a hazy golden color, small white head. Aroma is banana, clove, citrus fruit, allspice, a bit of corriander. Flavor is lemons, citrusy and spicey, "wheaty" body. (think the cereal). Smooth finish. Nice brew.

GABF 2005

Aroma:  citrus, honey, herbs, light coriander

Appearance:  murky yellow, small white head

Flavor:  light wheat, egg whites, spices, and little citrus

Palate:  light, creamy, and fluffy

09.30.05  GABF  An almost syrupy appearance, this stuff is thick, opaque, and generally attractive beneath a thick white head.  Luscious aromas of wheaty fruits, peaches, lemongrass, and touches of spice.  Mouthfeel is light and effy, despite its thick appearance, but its plenty coating and theres a crispness about it that pleases.  This would be nice with pub fare.  Pretty sweet, but with enough background and finishing tart acidity to keep you coming back.  Not at all cloying.

Sweet and perfumy throughout the nose. Very fresh, fruity and full on the senses. Nose of bananas, pears, fruit cocktail, and some hearty wheat. Smooth aqnd rich, sticky and coating the mouth with a sweet, husky wheat and rye flavor. Sweet and hearty is the key here, making this one a very good hefeweizen indeed, even though its too much on the sweet side.

GABF 2005: Hazy straw hue with a nice big frothy head and very good lace. The aroma has a heavy banana, clove, and lemongrass esters along with wheaty notes. The taste start with a nice fresh weizen character with lots of fruity elements and subdued spice and wheat for depth. The palate is crisp and lively, very refreshing bier. Mikey likey, one the better American-made hefeweizens I have tried.

Tap at Ginger Man Austin.  Thick creamy white head on a pale golden body.  Aroma is very yeasty and has loads of bananas and tropical fruit.  Taste was of sharp wheat, citrus, typical hefe flavors.  These typical hefe flavors are so well done and come across on a smooth mouthfeel.  Some may say Im biased because Im from Texas, so what, maybe I am.  This ruled.

GABF 2005. Awww yea! Awesome aroma, citrus, corriander, candy. Big white head, pale cloudy yellow body. Earthy, wheaty taste with a smattering of citurs. Nice bitter and clean finish. This certainly lived up to my expectations.

GABF 05.  Cloudy straw body, white head.  Very strong "hefe" aroma, the usual clove, banana and yeast.  Strong but not terribly remarkable.  Theflavor falls off a bit with wheat malt taking the lead and banana/lemon alongside.  Bitter, yeasty finish.
(GABF05) Cloudy straw body with white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, strong banana, clove, some wheat.  Taste is medium sweet, lemon, banana, some wheat.  Light body with nice tartness.
Hazy gold in color with a small white head. Aroma of bananas and subtle clove. Flavor is of bananas,sweet,tart and bready.

Sampled on draft, Ginger Man, Dallas. Ive heard a fair amount of criticism of American-made hefes. Live Oak Hefeweizen will make a skeptic believe that American breweries can nail this style. Cloudy, tarnished gold in appearance with a scattered white head. Aroma is clean with some lemon and notes of banana. Banana, clove, pepper, vanilla/bubblegum are found amid the tart wheat flavor. Very complex, sophisticated & understated. Medium-bodied, moderately carbonated and creamy-smooth. Balanced with a clean finish. A MUST try. Im not certain what the brewer could do to make this beer any better.

On draught at Lovejoys in Austin.  This beer is delicious!  LO has just about perfected this one as it has just the right amount of banana, clove, sweetness, and finish that you want in a Hefe.  It is so comforting to see this beer in so many bars & restaurants in Austin now so that you can have an easy-drinkin LO Hefe with your meal.  We are very lucky to have this beer in town.  Excellent beer.
Looks like a foggy pilsner. The nose and taste is very "weizen" with lots of fresh citrus and sweetness, ending in a more dry, wood flavor. A bit watery aftertaste, however.
(Draught)  Pours a lightly cloudy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma of clove, citrus, and coriander.  Spicy yeast flavor with a hint of fruit.

Pours a full golden yellow with specs of clouds floating carelessly in its wonderful maize-tinted sky.  The aroma is a sweet mixture of wheat and hops, with an ever-so-slight malt presence in the background.  This is a classic Hefe, as close to a quality German as one is likely to find in der United States, with a few other exceptions.  A nice, sweet and sour brew that doesnt require a lemon to bring out its full character.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
so i was at the gman sipping on a devils backbone and taking notes and b.sing with the barman and saw that this was on tap also so i was thinking of having it when i finished my current beer. a lady walks in with some guy and asks for a wheat beer that isnt too sweet. and the guy behind the bar goes through his mantra of wheat beers, but doesnt mention this one, so i inject myself into their discussion and mention the live oak, he responds that he forgot they recieved that one and the lady states she would like to try it, so he pours her a small taste, she smiles and says she will take a pint, i think,alright, this could be a good one when i finish my devil. so the barman and i discuss the hefe, he says he finds it too yeasty but enjoyable, i scoff and think to myself that this man must be inexperienced with hefeweizens i was wrong.;
pours cloudy like grapefruit juice that contains a lot of pulp with a popping white head. this is the murkiest hefe i have encountered. raw yeast aroma like a starter for a homebrew that dominates with a weird urinal aspect and a slight roast banana hint. wow this was murky like a creek in east texas where all the clay in the soil gets agitated in the rain, just thick with yeasty goodness. strong flavor that i expected to be sweet,  before i heard the young lady say she enjoyed it, but was not sweet to the extent many hefes tend to be. very grassy and has a fresh green bean taste. reminds me of the fresh veggies that my family used to grow out in the country when i was a kid and we would eat them the same day they were picked and they would sometimes still have this dirty taste to them. there is some light banana in the finish.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2007 Gingerman - Dallas. Finally, a hefe that I can detect bubblegum from. Ive always  thought other raters were just making that up. Big creamy head. Lots of banana flavors. Delicious. The whole pint was gone in a matter of a few minutes. I cant wait to have another tomorrow.

Had on tap at the Ginger Man in Austin, Tx.Found this to be an excellent wheat. Nice, thick pour with an everpresent pure white head with heavy lacing. Yeasty aroma of bananas and flowers. Detect bananas in the flavor as well with a bit of bubblegum in the aftertaste. Nice light orange cloudy appearance. Sort of like a banana and bubblegum milkshake. Very refreshing - I could envision quaffing down several of these at the beach. Probably one of the best domestic wheats I have had yet.

Yeasty, fruity and somewhat sulphurous aroma.  Medium sweetness.   Lightly tart, a yeast assault and not very bitter.  Super hazy, almost opaque.  Ive seen primary fermentations that were clearer.  Banana really kicks in in the finish, like a banana beer smoothie.  Balanced, drinkable, impressive.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2005 Rerate on tap at Gingerman on 8/21/05: Cloudy golden with a frothy white head.  Aroma is nicely yeasty and malty with good black pepper and banana citrus spice.  Smooth, tasty, citrusy, malty, yeasty and very nicely balanced.  An authentic and very enjoyable hefeweizen.

GABF 2004: Hazy golden color with a frothy white head.  Wonderfully authentic sweet malted wheat and bready German yeasty aroma.  Body is mildly bready and sweet throughout, but thins toward the finish and has a touch too much citric acidity.  Still a very nice German hefeweizen, quite well balanced, and very drinkable.

Draught at Flying Saucer Draught Emporium, Houston, Texas.Hazy orange beer with a fine white head. Mild fruity aroma with tones of citrus and oranges. Yeasty and wheaty flavor with some fruit also. Flavorfull but rather harsh. Foamy mouthfull.

Hazy, dark yellow, with a white head.  Flavor: bubble gum.  Lots of it.  Aroma: some sweet, fruity notes of coriander and banana, quite decent here.  Odd palate--slightly "murky", and though carbonated it didnt feel "fresh in my mouth".  Somewhat dry finish. (on tap, Flying Saucer, Addison, TX)

Great brew. A very good German Hefe as far as im concerned. Could use a bigger head. Nice pale straw color. Smells like soo much buble gum its driving me crazy. Cloves and bananas as well. Great mouthfeel, great mouthfeel. Coats like liquid love.
Good brew

My sample was old, I was told, but it was still good!  Classic hefe characteristics, but not overpowering.
So glad to have a hefe that shows its German side rather than the lame American style. This has many of the classic flaavours - banana, clove - it is a tad sweet, but enjoy it just the same
Good head and lace, this was a surprisingly good find!  Nice taste, not overly strong on the fruitiness, but very refreshing.
Very good Hefe, but not the best.  Could taste the citrus, but didnt taste the bubble gum.
